title: Now list your top 3 sans serif faces
content:
Thanks for the serif advice for my alumni magazine redesign. I think I’ll look into Miller or Sabon Next for the main text serif font.

Now I’m persuading them to pick a new sans serif. Must work as a headline, subhead and sidebar text. Large family a plus. Any favorite sans? Any that would work well with Sabon/Miller?

I’m drawn to Stalemate or Tschichold at the moment.

 [‹ Typing with accents](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201172546/http:/typophile.com/node/12669 "Go to previous forum topic") [Typeface research. Dyslexia. ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201172546/http:/typophile.com/node/10568 "Go to next forum topic")
author: bDIN

comments.content:
Three?! Only three?!

Parisine  
Futura (Bitstream not Adobe)  
Auto

bDIN,

Thanks for concidering Stalemate ;-)

Cheers

I like very much the way ITC Bailey works in magazine text, but it only has the normal and the bold weight.

I saw Tschichold and I liked it, a very Garamondesque Gill Sans.

Chianti BT is a humanist sans serif which works nicely in body text, has old style figures, caps, a nice set of italic swashes and alternates and three weights.

Héctor
I have always wanted to use Storm’s [John Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201172546/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/storm/john-sans/) for something.

My current favorite big family sanses:

- [Amplitude](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201172546/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&font_categories=1&font_categories_search=font_name_search&searchstr=amplitude)  
- [ITC Legacy Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201172546/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=legacy%20sans&font_categories_checkbox=font_keyword_search&x=34&y=10)  
- [FF Zwo](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201172546/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&font_categories=1&font_categories_search=font_name_search&searchstr=zwo)
